abstract.text: A specialized view controller that provides a graphical interface for selecting media items.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: object, or media item picker, is a specialized view controller that you employ to provide a graphical interface for selecting media items. To display a media item picker, present it modally on an existing view controller. Presenting an
in non-modal mode; for example, pushing a
stack causes your app to crash.
To respond to user selections and to dismiss a media item picker, use the

class supports portrait mode only. This class doesn’t support subclassing, and don’t modify the view hierarchy, which is private. In a compatible iPad or iPhone app in visionOS, presenting this picker displays an alert notifying the person that picking media items isn’t supported.

abstract.text: A container view controller that defines a stack-based scheme for navigating hierarchical content.
Find and play songs, audio podcasts, audio books, and more from within your app.
A collection of properties that represents a single item in the media library.
A specialized view controller that provides a graphical interface for selecting media items.
Initializes a media item picker for all media types.
A Boolean value specifying the default selection behavior for a media item picker.
The delegate for a media item picker.
Initializes a media item picker for specified media types.
The media types that media item picker presents.
A prompt, for the user, that appears above the navigation bar buttons.
A Boolean value specifying whether to display iCloud Media Library items for a media picker.
A Boolean value that specifies whether the media item picker displays protected assets.
The protocol you implement so that a media item picker can respond to a user making media item selections.
A slider control for setting the system audio output volume, and a button for choosing the audio output route.
Let users choose the music they want to play by displaying a media picker interface from within your app.

doc://com.apple.mediaplayer/documentatio.title: Displaying a media picker from your app

abstract.text: An object that manages a view hierarchy for your UIKit app.
A protocol that enables an object to be encoded and decoded for archiving and distribution.
The interface an app extension uses to respond to a request from a host app.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A protocol that an object adopts to create a bar object in your app.
An interface that provides a source for shareable content to fulfill user requests to share current content.
A protocol that a class must adopt to allow appearance customization using the [`UIAppearance`](doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIAppearance) API.
A set of methods for adapting the contents of your view controllers to size and trait changes.
A set of methods that define the focus behavior for a branch of the view hierarchy.
The interface that determines whether a responder object supports paste configuration.
A set of standard methods that apps can adopt to support editing.
Methods for adding objects to your state restoration archives.
A set of methods that makes the iOS interface environment available to your app.
The protocol you adopt to restore an object’s state from a user activity.
A type that calls your code in reaction to changes in the trait environment.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
